meanings.definition: The protruding part of the face below the mouth, formed by the lower jaw.
meanings.sent1: She gently touched her chin as she looked in the mirror.
meanings.sent2: His beard covered his chin, making it look even larger.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended her chin was a mountain for her toy climbers.
meanings.sent4: His determination was written all over his chin as he faced the challenge.
meanings.sent5: The boxer's chin was his weak spot in the match.

meanings.definition: To rest one's chin on something.
meanings.sent1: The tired man decided to chin his hands on the table and take a nap.
meanings.sent2: She liked to chin her elbows on the windowsill to watch the birds outside.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to chin the edge of the bookshelf but slipped and fell.
meanings.sent4: He would often chin his chin on his palm while lost in thought.
meanings.sent5: The student would chin his chin on his backpack during the boring lecture.

meanings.definition: To bring one's chin up in defiance.
meanings.sent1: Despite the criticism, she decided to chin up and continue with her project.
meanings.sent2: He would chin up whenever someone questioned his beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The child would chin up whenever told to eat vegetables, making a funny face.
meanings.sent4: In the face of adversity, she would chin up and tackle the challenges head-on.
meanings.sent5: The team captain's words made him chin up and give his best performance.
